definition-item.definition-title: COIN-FREED OR LIKE APPARATUS (coin sorting G07D3/00; coin testing G07D5/00; {handling coins or paper currencies apart from payment activated apparatus G07D; payment architectures, schemes or protocols G06Q20/00})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Payment architectures, schemes or protocols
Handling coins or paper currencies apart from payment activated apparatus
Coin sorting
Coin testing

definition-item.definition-title: Coin inlet arrangements; Coins specially adapted to operate coin-freed mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

All details of the coin input specific to vending and other payment-activated machines, such as coin inlets, coin chutes and input channels, as well as special coin-alike tokens used for payment-activated devices.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coins as such
Coin and currency recognition as such

definition-item.definition-title: Coins specially adapted to operate coin-freed mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coins as such
Coin and currency recognition as such

section-body.paragraph-text: In patent documents the following expressions/ words are often used:
tokens, jetons, Münzänhliche Objekten.

definition-item.definition-title: Coin-actuated mechanisms; Interlocks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
All devices (mechanical) or circuits (electrical) specific for actuating the dispensing action or operation of a coin-freed or vending device.
General coin recognition classified in G07D.

definition-item.definition-title: specially adapted for controlling several coin-freed apparatus from one place

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Coin-actuated central mechanisms and devices specially adapted for centrally controlling several coin-freed apparatus or multiple vending systems from one common place, mostly the central coin-payment unit being in the same space as the units to be controlled.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Interlocks per se
Vending machine being part of a centrally controlled network of vending machines

definition-item.definition-title: with change-giving

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Vending machines with dispensing of a set of coins as change when the sum paid in exceeds the required price for an article to be dispensed. This set of coins being established according to a rule of giving change.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing of unused coins
Counting of coins inserted
Coin changing mechanisms as such, independently of its use within a dispensing or vending device

definition-item.definition-title: Interlocks, e.g. for locking the doors of compartments other than that to be used

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The control of opening of one single door within a group of compartments.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Locking arrangements for doors of lockers

definition-item.definition-title: Mechanisms actuated by objects other than coins to free or to actuate vending, hiring, coin or paper currency dispensing or refunding apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Details of HOW you pay by anything having money value except coins, banknotes or other physical currency. In particular, this group covers payments by cards or devices representing, permitting or granting access to an account.
The term "mechanisms actuated by objects other than coins" is to be read as "payment activated by cards and objects or tokens, other than coins, representing value or the right to access and account"
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Complete banking systems
Data processing for business
Data processing for commerce, shopping or e-commerce
Handling coins or paper currencies apart from coin-freed or like apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:
Complete banking systems, devices and systems used for payment transactions, e.g. ATMs.

definition-item.definition-title: by keys or other credit registering devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cards which are person independent, e.g. a telephone card.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cards belonging to a person but for which no verification of the identity of the user for their use is required
Mechanisms actuated by keys or other credit registering devices for producing a coded signal for use together with coded identity cards

definition-item.definition-title: {by means, e.g. cards, providing billing information at the time of purchase, e.g. identification of seller or purchaser, quantity of goods delivered or to be delivered}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Specific physical means or cards defining a billed service or quantity of goods to be delivered or the identification of a seller or purchaser defined for this service.

definition-item.definition-title: by paper currency

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Vending machines and dispensers in which a banknote is input and serves as payment means.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of the coin inlets and chutes
Vending machines and dispensers for which one or more coins serve as payment means

definition-item.definition-title: by returnable containers {, i.e. reverse vending systems in which a user is rewarded for returning a container that serves as a token of value}, e.g. bottles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Objects serve as a token of value. Money or payment is given back as reward of the recycling or returning of the object. Returnable containers include also syringes.

definition-item.definition-title: {by fluid containers, e.g. bottles, cups, gas containers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Recycling of bottles and cups, and getting a reward or refund.

definition-item.definition-title: {by carts}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The use of a trolley or cart is made dependent on the (temporary) payment of a token or coin which is given back to the payer when trolley or cart is returned or locked back in/to a storage zone.
If the trolley serves as a registration and/or a portable scanner, classified in G07G1/0081.
In patent documents the following words are often use:
trolley, chariot, shopping basket

definition-item.definition-title: {by box-like containers, e.g. videocassettes, books}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Objects having a box-like form, such as videocassettes, CD boxes, books, etc. are recognized on return / recycling and give right ot a payment or access to similar object.
In patent documents the following words are often used:
Reverse vending system.

definition-item.definition-title: by coded identity card or credit card {or other personal identification means (without personal verification means G07F7/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cards which are used independently of their owner's identity.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanisms actuated by cards or other personal identification means without personal verification means

section-body.paragraph-text: If the identity of the owner of the card is characterizing the payment done by means of the token or card, classify in G07F7/10, e.g. a PIN is required to use the rights defined by the card.

definition-item.definition-title: together with a coded signal {, e.g. in the form of personal identification information, like personal identification number [PIN] or biometric data}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cards for which the identity of the owner of the card is characterizing and required for the payment done by means of the token or card.
The identity of the owner of the token or payment card is verified biometrically or using a PIN.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Controlled computer access
Identity verification for access

section-body.paragraph-text: If the identity of the owner of the card is NOT characterizing the payment done by means of the token or card and the card serves for payment by itself, classify in G07F7/08.

definition-item.definition-title: {Devices or methods for securing the PIN and other transaction-data, e.g. by encryption (arrangements for secret communication, see H04L9/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cards with means for encrypting data required and essential to the payment, e.g. PIN.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for secret communication

section-body.paragraph-text: Same subject-matter when being only part or step in a payment protocol and not limited to the card used and its features need a classification in G06Q20/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Card verification

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Verification of the card based on constructive or software features.

definition-item.definition-title: Details other than those peculiar to special kinds or types of apparatus (coin inlet arrangements G07F1/00; coin-actuated mechanisms, interlocks G07F5/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Aspects and means of payment actuated vending machines and dispensers that are not specific to a special kind of apparatus or a dispenser for dispensing a particular article or service.
Details specific to a certain type of dispenser should be classified under the pertinent subgroups in the range G07F11/00 - G07F17/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin inlet arrangements
Coin-actuated mechanisms, interlocks

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin testing arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: {Interfacing with vending machines using mobile or wearable devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Using a wearable or mobile device for ordering, paying, interacting, operating or monitoring vending machines, non-specific to a type of vending machine or a product or service provided.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Data display, advertising or data presentation of vending machines
Alarm and monitoring, e.g. for auditing functioning of vending machines
Head mounted human machine interaction means
Wearable computers, e.g. on a belt
Input and output arrangements for interaction between user and computer

definition-item.definition-title: {Vending machines being part of a centrally controlled network of vending machines}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payments and transactions in centrally controlled networks of dispensers and vending machines mainly connected to servers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin-actuated mechanisms specially adapted for controlling several coin-freed apparatus from one place

definition-item.definition-title: {displaying the inserted coins}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin chutes with eventual display of inserted coins
Coin recognition as such

definition-item.definition-title: {User recognition or proximity detection}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
User recognition and proximity detection at a vending machine, e.g. for control by gesture, user profiling or power saving.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Data display, advertising or data presentation of vending machines
Alarm and monitoring, e.g. for auditing functioning of vending machines
Input arrangements in computers
Biometric computer user authentication

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for alarm or indication, e.g. when empty; Advertising arrangements in coin-freed apparatus (alarms or warning devices indicating the interruption of flow to be metered G07F15/10)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Features defining the features relating to data display and presentation, to monitoring the stock, to the checking of minimum age requirements to have right to access the articles, to the centralized control of a number of vending machines or other aspects not specific to a particular type of vending machine.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Alarms or warning devices indicating the interruption of flow to be metered

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements for display, data presentation or advertising}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Displaying information, or presenting selection menus or advertisements on vending machines and self-service dispensers.

If the data displayed is provided by the means for auditing/monitoring of the functioning of the payment activated apparatus, e.g. indicating the actual inventory of the apparatus or that the stock of (a part of) the machine is exhausted, the aspects concerning the monitoring features need to be classified also in G07F9/026.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Alarm and monitoring, e.g. for auditing functioning of vending machines
Display aspects as part of the housing of an ATM
Touchscreen for human/computer interaction
Displays of POS and ECRs

definition-item.definition-title: {the arrangements being full-front touchscreens}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Vending machine having a full-front touch-screen data input serving for data display and transaction selection.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Interfacing with a vending machine using a mobile or wearable device, e.g. for ordering, paying, operating the vending machine
Data display, advertising or data presentation of vending machines
Alarm and monitoring, e.g. for auditing functioning of vending machines
Touchscreen for human/computer interaction

definition-item.definition-title: {for alarm, monitoring and auditing in vending machines or means for indication, e.g. when empty}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Indicating operational conditions of the vending machine, e.g. alarms, information about the actual inventory of the vending machine, stock depletion of (a part of) the articles in the vending machine.

If the data provided by the means for auditing/monitoring of the functioning of the payment activated apparatus is also displayed on the vending machine, e.g. indicating the actual inventory of the apparatus or that the stock of (a part of) the machine is exhausted, the aspects concerning the displaying features need to be classified also in G07F9/023.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensers as part of a centrally controlled network of dispensers
Data display, advertising or data presentation of vending machines
Specific restocking arrangements for dispensers and vending machines
Monitoring of ATM functioning
Inventory or stock management in warehousing
Alarm indicators in checkouts and systems for registering receipt of cash, e.g. anti-theft or false operation

definition-item.definition-title: Means for returning surplus or unused coins

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Vending machine accepts payment and returns any excess or unrecognized coins.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensers giving change
Returning of excess coins in general

definition-item.definition-title: Coin boxes

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Coin boxes within vending machines or other payment activated machines.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin slots
Coin chutes
Coin boxes in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Coin-like tokens specific to a purpose should be classified in G07F1/06 (and also the eventual purpose or object paid for).

definition-item.definition-title: Counting total of coins inserted

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Counting within the dispenser of a number of coins inserted for payment.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Actuation of the dispenser according to the number and type of coin input
Counting of coins in general

definition-item.definition-title: Casings {or parts thereof}, e.g. with means for heating or cooling

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Housings of vending machines with temperature or internal environmental condition control.
Means for temperature and environment control (e.g. humidity) within a vending machine or dispenser are classified in G07F9/105.

definition-item.definition-title: {Heating or cooling means, for temperature and humidity control, for the conditioning of articles and their storage (dispensers for food articles requiring a processing by temperature treatment or conditioning before they are ready for dispensing G07F17/0064)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for temperature and environment control (e.g. humidity) within a vending machine or dispenser.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensers for food requiring heating or cold serving

definition-item.definition-title: Coin-freed apparatus for dispensing, or the like, discrete articles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arrangements for insuring that only one single article may be dispensed at a time from the storage zones and/or the delivery means of a dispenser of objects.
NB: The term "coin-freed" is to be read as "payment activated".
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Storage arrangements for article presentation without controlled access for dispensing
Industrial article storage and conveying or commissioning systems

definition-item.definition-title: {Restocking arrangements therefor}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Specific arrangements for restocking of vending machines, e.g. restocking by loading of modular unit of multiple articles.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Data display, advertising or data presentation of vending machines, e.g. indication of low stock or inventory depletion
Alarm and monitoring, e.g. for auditing functioning of vending machines, e.g. monitoring of stock inventory
Cartridge magazines for beverage making apparatus
Inventory and stock management in warehousing

definition-item.definition-title: from non-movable magazines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage of articles in fixed receptacles not provided in any of the other (sub)groups in G07F11/00-G07F11/68.

definition-item.definition-title: in which magazines the articles are stored one vertically above the other

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arrangements for storage of articles piled one above the other and not fitting in the principle of any of the hierarchically dependent subgroups.
Flexible articles such as newspapers classified in G07F11/045 and/or in G07F11/14 as such piles are often topmost dispensed.

definition-item.definition-title: {for sheet shaped or pliable articles}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage and dispensing of flexible articles such as newspapers or towels, blankets.
Cards may be classified here only if their flexibility is used or essential to the storage or dispensing principle.
Articles stored as a pile of which the topmost is dispensed need also a class in G07F11/14.

definition-item.definition-title: supported individually on pivotally-mounted flaps or shelves

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Storage of the articles is done on flaps or shelves which function as a support for the article as non-moving elements but only till the article needs to be dispensed at which moment the flap pivots to let free the article into a delivery zone.

definition-item.definition-title: arranged in two columns in staggered relationship

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage of articles as a zigzag arrangement within one single column.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Storage of articles in two separate columns which both dispense the article into a common outlet delivery zone

definition-item.definition-title: two or more magazines having a common delivery chute

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage of articles in two separate columns which both dispense the article into a common outlet delivery zone.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Storage of articles as a zigzag arrangement within one single column

definition-item.definition-title: with means for automatically changing to reserve stacks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage in a first column and use of the second column only when first is exhausted.

definition-item.definition-title: with means for raising the stack of articles to permit delivery of the topmost

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage of articles as a pile which needs to be raised or lifted to dispense one single article form the top, (eventual by pusher).
Newspapers and flexible articles are also classified in G07F11/045 if the flexibility of the article is essential for the storage or dispensing or delivery principle.

definition-item.definition-title: Delivery means

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Delivery means, for any type of storage (movable and non-movable magazines).
This group or its subgroups may also be applied if the article storage is done in movable magazines, in combination with the pertinent group G07F11/46.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by blocking access to the output bins}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Blocking access to the output bin of the delivery means of vending machines and dispensers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing of articles stored in movable magazines

definition-item.definition-title: {the picking arrangements being collecting buckets}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Delivery of stored articles by means moving along at least more than one axis of freedom as in two- or multi-dimensional (e.g. XYZ) article picking arrangement, in which the picking arrangement is a collecting bucket.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing of articles stored in movable magazines
Delivering or advancing articles from machine, and in industrial applications

definition-item.definition-title: {the picking arrangements using suction}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Delivery of stored articles by suction means moving to picking position.
This group may also be applied for the articles stored in movable as well as non-movable magazines and not only in case of a multidimensional picking arrangement.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing of articles stored in movable magazines
Article or material handling devices associated with conveyors
Delivering or advancing articles from machine, and in industrial applications

definition-item.definition-title: Recessed drawers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of recessed drawers as delivery means.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Articles in drawers used as compartments

definition-item.definition-title: Pushers actuated directly by hand

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of pushers actuated directly by hand for delivery of article(s).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pushers in delivery means of dispensers actuated indirectly by hand, e.g. through cranks or levers
Article being delivered by hand-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines

definition-item.definition-title: Pushers actuated indirectly by hand, e.g. through cranks or levers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of pushers actuated indirectly by hand for delivery of article(s), e.g. through cranks or levers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Pushers in delivery means of dispensers actuated directly by hand
Article being delivered by hand-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines

definition-item.definition-title: Rotary or oscillatory members

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Use of rotary or oscillatory member, such as rotary delivery means at bottom of columns or with chambers selecting one out of a row or pile of articles, e.g. singling device for delivery of one out of a column or row.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Non-movable helical or spiral magazines
Use of rotary means as storage means

definition-item.definition-title: Endless bands

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of endless bands as delivery means.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Article being delivered by motor-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines
Articles are supported on endless belts or conveyors, used as movable magazines, containers or supports
Articles are stored and rectilinearly movable, but not by endless belts or conveyors

definition-item.definition-title: in which the magazines are of helical or spiral form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Coin-freed apparatus for dispensing, or the like, discrete articles, from non-movable magazines, in which the non-movable magazines are of helical or spiral form.
This subgroup covers only articles in rigid magazines of helical or spiral form, not articles held within the coils of an advancing or movable helical or spiral feeder.

If the articles are pushed or held by motor-driven helical or spiral means serving as pusher or advancing means, the articles being piled in a row, it should be classified in G07F11/42 as "articles delivered by motor-driven means within non-movable magazines". If the coils serve also as storage compartments advancing the articles to a delivery point, then the document should be classified in G07F11/36.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Rotary or oscillatory means used as delivery means, a singling device at the end of a row or column
Motor-driven conveying means of articles within horizontal non-movable magazines, e.g. articles piled in a row moved as a whole to delivery point
The article being delivered from movable storage containers or supports, wherein the storage containers or supports being rotatably mounted about horizontal axes
The articles being supported on or by endless belts or like conveyers
Articles are stored and rectilinearly movable, but not by endless belts or conveyors, e.g. articles held in the coils of a helical or spiral feed

definition-item.definition-title: the articles being delivered by motor-driven means

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Payment-actuated dispensing, or the like, of discrete articles, from non-movable horizontal magazines, the articles being delivered by motor driven means e.g. a helical or spiral form advancing means which can hold articles in its coils or push a complete row of articles to a delivery point.

Only if the articles are pushed by motor-driven helical or spiral means serving as pusher or advancing means, the articles being in a row or held by the coils as storage compartments, the document should be classified in G07F11/42 as "articles delivered by motor-driven means within non-movable magazines, as the helical means may be seen as only feeding pusher means within a non-movable magazine, as "articles delivered by motor-driven means within non-movable magazines".

In case the articles are held in the coils of a helical means, this is considered to need also classification in G07F11/60 as "articles held in storage containers or supports (being the coils) which are rectilinearly movable as movable magazines".
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Rotary or oscillatory members/means used as delivery means
Magazines being non-movable and of helical or spiral form
Article being delivered by hand-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines
Dispensing from rotatably mounted storage containers or supports (horizontal or vertical)
Articles are supported on endless belts or conveyors, used as movable magazines, containers or supports
Articles are stored and rectilinearly movable, but not by endless belts or conveyors

definition-item.definition-title: in which magazines the articles are stored in bulk

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage from a hopper with dosing of the quantity to be dispensed.
May also require a class in G07F13/00 or G07F15/00 if type of article dispensed is powder or granular or liquid.

definition-item.definition-title: the storage containers or supports being rotatably mounted

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Payment-actuated dispensing, or the like, of discrete articles, from movable magazines, the articles being held in storage containers rotating around an axis, such as in a carrousel of storage receptacles or supports.

If the articles are pushed by motor-driven helical or spiral means serving as pusher or advancing means, the articles being in a row or held by the coils as storage compartments, the document should be classified in G07F11/42 as "articles delivered by motor-driven means within non-movable magazines, as the helical means may be seen as only feeding pusher means within a non-movable magazine, as "articles delivered by motor-driven means within non-movable magazines".

In case the articles are held in the coils of a helical means, this is considered to need also classification in G07F11/60 as "articles held in storage containers or supports (being the coils) which are rectilinearly movable as movable magazines".

definition-item.definition-title: about horizontal axes

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Payment-actuated dispensing, or the like, of discrete articles, from movable magazines, the articles being held in storage containers rotating around a horizontal axis, such as in a carrousel of storage receptacles or supports.
If the articles are stored in magazines of helical or spiral form themselves and these magazines are non-movable, it will be classified as G07F11/36.

In case the articles are held in the coils of a helical means, this is considered to need classification in G07F11/60 as "articles held in storage containers or supports (being the coils) which are rectilinearly movable as movable magazines.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Rotary or oscillatory members/means used as delivery means
Magazines being non-movable and of helical or spiral form
Article being delivered by hand-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines
Dispensing from rotatably mounted storage containers or supports (around vertical axes)
Articles are supported on endless belts or conveyors, used as movable magazines, containers or supports
Articles are stored and rectilinearly movable, but not by endless belts or conveyors

definition-item.definition-title: the articles being supported on or by endless belts or like conveyors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment-actuated apparatus for dispensing, or the like, discrete articles, supported on endless belts or like conveyors which move the articles to a delivery point.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Endless bands, only as (final) delivery means
Article being delivered by motor-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines
Dispensing from rotatably mounted storage containers or supports (horizontal or vertical)
Articles are stored and rectilinearly movable, but not by endless belts or conveyors

definition-item.definition-title: the storage containers or supports being rectilinearly movable

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Coin-freed apparatus for dispensing, or the like, discrete articles, from movable storage containers or supports, in which the storage containers or supports are being rectilinearly movable, such articles held in the coils of helical feed means which serve as moving containers or supports.

If the articles are pushed by motor-driven helical or spiral means serving as pusher or advancing means, the articles being in a row, the document should be classified as G07F11/42 as "articles delivered by motor-driven means within non-movable magazines, as the helical means may be seen as only feeding pusher means within a non-movable magazine, as "articles delivered by motor-driven means within non-movable magazines".

In case the articles are held in the coils of a helical means, this is considered to need also classification in G07F11/60 as "articles held in storage containers or supports (being the coils) which are rectilinearly movable as movable magazines".
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements for insuring that one single article is dispensed
Rotary or oscillatory members/means used as delivery means
Article being delivered by hand-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines
Article being delivered by motor-driven means from horizontal non-moving magazines
Dispensing from rotatably mounted storage containers or supports (horizontal or vertical)
Articles are supported on endless belts or conveyors, used as movable magazines, containers or supports

definition-item.definition-title: in which the articles are stored in compartments in fixed receptacles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Payment actuated apparatus for dispensing, or the like, of discrete articles, from compartments, storage containers or defined storage supports, which may be organised as a moving drawer composed of fixed compartments.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensers for pharmaceutical articles
Chest of drawers or cabinets characterised by the arrangement of drawers
Drawers for cabinets and tables, or like furniture
Medicament distribution means for multiple medicaments
Cash register drawers
Computer-assisted distribution of medication from dispensers, i.e. making sure that medication is correctly delivered to patients

definition-item.definition-title: in which the articles are individually suspended from stationary supports

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage of articles hanging one by one or suspended along supports such as rails.

definition-item.definition-title: in which the articles are torn or severed from strips or sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage along a strip of articles and severing one of the articles, blister-pack.

definition-item.definition-title: in which the articles are formed in the apparatus from components, blanks, or material constituents

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Storage and articles which are stored as components which need to be combined for dispensing, or which serve only as required for the use of another article even if not dispensed from same dispenser, e.g. bun dispensing for a food vending machine.
Additionally to the concept classified in this group, the fitting class in the storage or delivery method or means in a separate G07F11/00 entry is required.

definition-item.definition-title: Auxiliary equipment, e.g. for lighting cigars, opening bottles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Storage and dispensing of articles which are supplementary to a main article dispensed, e.g. lighter or matches for a cigarette vending machine, bottle opener for drink bottle vendor.
Cups dispensed with a drink should be classified according to the type of drink and in G07F13/10.

definition-item.definition-title: Coin-freed apparatus for controlling dispensing or fluids, semiliquids or granular material from reservoirs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Dispensing a quantity of a liquid such as water or oil, if not provided for the definition of any of the dependent groups.
NB: The term "coin-freed" is to be read as "payment activated".
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for making beverages
Liquid dispensing in general, such as water or petrol
Apparatus for dispensing beverages on draught

section-body.paragraph-text: Fuel dispensing systems at petrol stations in G07F13/025. Drinks in G07F13/065 except hot drinks such as coffee, in G07F13/10 (as mostly a cup is also dispensed if required).

definition-item.definition-title: {wherein the volume is determined during delivery}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel dispensing systems at petrol stations

definition-item.definition-title: {for drink preparation}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Coin-freed apparatus for controlling dispensing or fluids, semi liquids or granular material from reservoirs, with selective dispensing of different fluids or materials (e.g. mixed), e.g. for drink preparation.

Hot drinks are often dispensed with cups or containers. In case details are given about the cup or container dispensing (eventually in coordination with the drink delivery), a classification in G07F13/10 is required.

definition-item.definition-title: in the form of a spray

section-body.paragraph-text: Needs also a class in G07F17/18 if for cosmetic beauty products.

definition-item.definition-title: with associated dispensing of containers, e.g. cups or other articles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Coin-freed apparatus for controlling dispensing or fluids, semi liquids or granular material from reservoirs, with associated dispensing of containers, e.g. cups or other containers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing discrete articles per se
Dispensers for drinks without further details about associated dispensing of containers, e.g. cups or other articles
Beverage-making apparatus with dispensing means for adding a measured quantity of ingredients, e.g. coffee, sugar, cocoa, milk, tea

definition-item.definition-title: Coin-freed apparatus with meter-controlled dispensing of liquid, gas or electricity

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment activated access to facilities such as public services, e.g. gas, electricity, water for housing.
NB: The term "coin-freed" is to be read as "payment activated".
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: For vending, access and use of specific services not covered anywhere else in G07F15/00
Gas or electricity for washing or hygiene or persons and animals (e.g. oxygen, shower, sun-tan cabin)
Tariff-metering apparatus in general
Data processing for electricity, gas and water supply

section-body.paragraph-text: The groups G07F15/00 - G07F15/008 may also be applied in combination, if necessary, with a group from G07F15/02 - G07F15/12.

definition-item.definition-title: {for gas}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Coin-freed apparatus for meter-controlled dispensing of gas.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing of gas for washing, drying or hygiene of persons (and animals)
Electric propulsion with power supplied within the vehicle

definition-item.definition-title: {for electricity}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment activated dispensing of electricity or charging of electricity into an object or apparatus.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dispensing of gas for washing, drying or hygiene of persons (and animals)
Electric propulsion with power supplied within the vehicle
Circuit arrangements for charging or depolarising batteries or for supplying loads from batteries

definition-item.definition-title: {dispensed for the electrical charging of vehicles (electrical charging as such, B60L50/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment actuated apparatus for meter-controlled and billed electricity for charging vehicles, such as cars and bicycles.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electrical (circuits for) charging of vehicles
Technologies related to electric vehicle charging (not used as head-group but see subgroups)

definition-item.definition-title: {dispensed for the electrical charging of other devices than vehicles}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment actuated apparatus for meter-controlled and billed electricity for charging devices other than vehicles, such as mobile phones.

definition-item.definition-title: {Rewarding for providing delivery of electricity to the network}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payments received for providing electricity back to the grid, e.g. in house environment or vehicle plugged into a charging station connected to the electrical network.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electric propulsion with power supplied within the vehicle
Enabling technologies with a potential or indirect contribution to GHG emissions mitigation

definition-item.definition-title: Coin-freed apparatus for hiring articles; Coin-freed facilities or services

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment activated access to various services and specific types of objects independently of their manner of storageor delivery arrangements.
NB: The term "coin-freed" is to be read as "payment activated".
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin-freed facilities for specific storage or delivery of single objects
Coin-freed facilities for liquid or granular articles
Coin-freed facilities for facilities such as electricity and gas
Prepayment telephone systems

definition-item.definition-title: {for vending, access and use of specific services not covered anywhere else in G07F17/00 (meter-controlled dispensing of liquid, gas or electricity G07F15/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices for access to specific services not being facilities covered anywhere else in G07F15/00 (metered dispensing of water, electricity, or gas) or specific services such as services for which a fitting indexation is possible within the G07F17/00 scheme, such as hotel reservations, conditional access to locations, waste deposits.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin-freed apparatus with meter-controlled dispensing of liquid, gas or electricity (tariff-metering apparatus in general, G01D4/00)

definition-item.definition-title: {Access to services on a time-basis}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices giving access to services metered or charged on a time-basis.
Devices for accessing the service are to be classified in this group but the payment protocols or architectures are to be classified in the pertinent G06Q20/00 or its subgroup(s).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for time-control in telephone networks

definition-item.definition-title: {Use of a wired telephone or public communication device (charging and metering the use of the telecommunication network H04M17/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices giving access to services through the public communication or wired telephone.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Prepayment for use of wireline communication systems or telephone systems

definition-item.definition-title: {Participation in a loyalty or discount scheme (data processing for shopping and discounts G06Q30/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices such as SST that give access to loyalty or discount schemes.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Data processing for granting discounts or incentives, e.g. coupons, rebates, offers or up-sales

definition-item.definition-title: {for processing of food articles (cooking vessels A47J37/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payments actuated dispensing of solid food products that need to be processed before delivery.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drinks and liquid food dispensers
Cooking vessels and devices

definition-item.definition-title: {for assembling and dispensing of pharmaceutical articles (medical dispensers for private use, A61J7/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment and identity actuated assembling and dispensing of orders of pharmaceutical articles or products.
Only devices similar to vending machines and dispensers are to be classified in G07F17/0092.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tables, desks, cabinets, drawers, general details of the same
Special furniture, fittings or accessories for shops, store houses or the like
Diagnosis, surgery, identification
Trolleys for transport of medicaments, transportation or accommodation for patients
Medicament (to be taken orally) distribution systems
Devices for introducing media into the body
Blister packages
Packaging of pills and medications
Containers for storage of articles
Transport or storage devices, e.g. industrial process for conveying packaged products
Handling thin or filamentary material, e.g. cutting or perforating strips
Systems or methods specially adapted for patient record management
Data processing specially adapted for medical matters and control of correct dispensing to patient

definition-item.definition-title: for means for safe-keeping of property, left temporarily, e.g. by fastening the property

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment for temporary keeping and locking of objects such as bicycles.

definition-item.definition-title: comprising lockable containers, e.g. for accepting clothes to be cleaned

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment actuated facilities or services comprising lockable containers, e.g. accepting clothes to be cleaned.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Interlocks, e.g. for locking the doors of compartments other than that to be used
Dispensers for articles in compartments in fixed receptacles
Deposit receptacles for parcels

definition-item.definition-title: {the containers being a postal pick-up locker}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment or identity actuated safe-keeping of property left temporarily for mail delivery in personally accessible lockers or locked compartments.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Interlocks, e.g. for locking the doors of compartments other than that to be used
Dispensers for articles in compartments in fixed receptacles
Mail and letter boxes, deposit receptacles
Individual access control to personal compartments

definition-item.definition-title: for fastenings for doors (of containers for safe keeping G07F17/12); for turnstiles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment actuated control only of real doors of accessible rooms and spaces, NOT doors of compartments in a cupboard or dispenser.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin-freed arrangements for fastenings for doors of containers for safe keeping, e.g. lockers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Interlocks (coin-freed) for locking doors of compartments other than that to be used
Individual entry or exit control for access to restricted areas

definition-item.definition-title: for devices exhibiting advertisements, announcements, pictures or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Payment actuated providing of content such as advertisements, announcements and pictures or video content, e.g. for display. Further also dispensing of on request created content carriers such as DVDs with on request or customized recorded matter, e.g. a payment activated machine for selling/hiring CDs or DVDs.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanisms and devices for returning box-like containers
Payment actuated system or device for printing, stamping, franking, tele-printing apparatus, e.g. delivering content onto blank records
Payment actuated processing of accepting of orders
Billing for content delivered in television system

definition-item.definition-title: for washing or drying persons

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment activated dispensing of any article required for personal hygiene of user or animal, such as cosmetics or towels.
Towels are also classified according to the principle of storage e.g. from a roll (G07F11/68).
Towels and articles required for washing and drying anything lese than a living being such as a person or animal, classify in G07F17/20.

definition-item.definition-title: for washing or drying articles, e.g. clothes, motor cars

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment activated dispensing of any article required for washing or drying of anything else than a living being such human or animal.
Towels and articles required for washing and drying anything lese than a living being such
As a person or animal, classify in G07F17/18.

definition-item.definition-title: for parking meters

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment for use of parking facilities.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for checking parking time

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Measuring parking time

definition-item.definition-title: for printing, stamping, franking, typing or teleprinting apparatus (ticket printing or the like apparatus G07F17/42)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Paying for (remotely) printed matter such as greeting cards.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ticket printing or the like apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Recording of content on carriers, e.g. CDs, DVDs

definition-item.definition-title: for games, toys, sports, or amusements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Gaming systems, or aspects thereof, which provide a financial reward, such as gambling, (Internet) betting and casino games. These aspects may relate to hardware, software, data processing, payments, security and game play specifics within the field of gaming systems providing financial rewards.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sports; Games; Amusements
Card, Board, Roulette Games or Video Games
Toys
Random number generators per se

section-body.paragraph-text: A document concerning a gaming system which provides a financial reward must always be classified in at least one of the groups G07F17/32 - G07F17/3283 according to the functional feature(s) it discloses (such a classification needs to be as INVention, not as an ADDitional classification).
Furthermore, one or more of the G07F17/3286 - G07F17/38 may optionally be assigned as ADDitional classification, depending on the type of game that the document discloses.

definition-item.definition-title: depending on the stopping of moving members {in a mechanical slot machine}, e.g. "fruit" machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Mechanical slot machines depending on the stopping of moving members, e.g. "fruit machines".
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Playing without coin collecting means
Traditional board, card or dice games without financial Reward
Video games without providing a financial reward
Toys
Random number generators per se

section-body.paragraph-text: A document concerning a mechanical slot machine must always be classified in at least one of the groups G07F17/32 - G07F17/3283 according to the functional feature(s) it discloses (such a classification needs to be as INVention, not as an ADDitional classification).
Furthermore, one or more of the G07F17/3286 - G07F17/38 may optionally be assigned as ADDitional classification, depending on the type of game that the document discloses.

definition-item.definition-title: for devices for accepting orders, advertisements, or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment actuated processing of accepted orders, or advertisements.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Payment actuated systems and devices for exhibiting content such as advertisements, announcements, pictures and the like
Payment actuated system or device for printing, stamping, franking, tele-printing apparatus, e.g. delivering content onto blank records
Payment actuated access to content providing services, e.g. fax

definition-item.definition-title: for ticket printing or like apparatus {, e.g. apparatus for dispensing of printed paper tickets or payment cards}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Payment activated access to printed matter such as paper tickets and payment cards.
The system for storage and dispensing should be classified if pertinent in G07F11/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Complete banking systems; Coded card-freed arrangements adapted for dispensing or receiving monies or the like and posting such transactions to existing accounts, e.g. automatic teller machines (data processing equipment for bank accounting G06Q40/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Automatic Banking machines (ATM) or complete banking networks.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Data processing equipment for bank accounting

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanisms in general actuated by objects other than coins
Protocols and data processing of payments
Handling coins or paper currencies apart from coin-freed or like apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: {Automatic teller machines [ATMs]}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
ATM (Automatic Transaction Machines) and Banking Terminals.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Testing the genuineness of paper currency
Handling of coins or of paper currency

definition-item.definition-title: {Use of an ATM as a switch or hub}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of an ATM as an information hub or switch for the service to be provided or (non-payment related) data to be delivered.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Network arrangements or protocols for real-time communications
